build

Class IO

  • java.lang.Object
    • build.IO

  • public class IO
extends java.lang.Object
    This class should simplify the read/write-process of the csv-files. Per file, one IO object has to be generated, so it could be handled easily like 'armfile.write()'.
    Version:
    2014-09-18
    Author:
    Michael Weinberger 4AHITT

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IO(java.lang.String path)
      IMPORTANT NOTICE: When initializing an IO object, use the 'getWorkingDir()' method from below first, then enter the user-input directory.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean checkDir()
      Checks if the directory, which the user entered is existent, otherwise it will be created.
      static void CheckFiles()
      Empty csv-files will be created in the directory.
      static java.lang.String getWorkingDir()
      So we actually know, that this code NEVER runs on the exact same system, under perfect circumstances.
      boolean overWrite(java.lang.String value)
      Writes a String value into a blank file on the HDD.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> read()
      Reads a file from the HDD and wraps it up into a String array.
      boolean write(java.lang.String value)
      Writes a String value into a file on the HDD.
      boolean writeRow(java.lang.String value)
      Writes a String value into a file on the HDD, with no line breaks.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • IO

        public IO(java.lang.String path)
        IMPORTANT NOTICE: When initializing an IO object, use the 'getWorkingDir()' method from below first, then enter the user-input directory. Looks like this: IO showcase = new IO(getWorkingDir() +userinput +"eye.csv");
        Parameters:
        path - Where the .csv-files are stored.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public boolean write(java.lang.String value)
        Writes a String value into a file on the HDD. Here, it is used to store robots in the storage.
        Parameters:
        value - A char sequence, which should be written.
        Returns:
        true in case of success, otherwise false.

      • writeRow

        public boolean writeRow(java.lang.String value)
        Writes a String value into a file on the HDD, with no line breaks. Here, it is used to store robots in the storage.
        Parameters:
        value - A char sequence, which should be written.
        Returns:
        true in case of success, otherwise false.

      • overWrite

        public boolean overWrite(java.lang.String value)
        Writes a String value into a blank file on the HDD. Here, it is used to store robots in the storage.
        Parameters:
        value - A char sequence, which should be written.
        Returns:
        true in case of success, otherwise false.

      • read

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> read()
        Reads a file from the HDD and wraps it up into a String array. Here it is used to get robots out of the storage.
        Returns:
        output The String array with every line of text from the file in it.

      • getWorkingDir

        public static java.lang.String getWorkingDir()
        So we actually know, that this code NEVER runs on the exact same system, under perfect circumstances. This method returns the actual directory, where the executed code was started.
        Returns:
        ready The entire file path.

      • CheckFiles

        public static void CheckFiles()
        Empty csv-files will be created in the directory.

      • checkDir

        public static boolean checkDir()
        Checks if the directory, which the user entered is existent, otherwise it will be created.
        Parameters:
        path - The entered filepath.
